item.title: Classification using Persistence Images
item.description: Galaxies Disclaimer: This sort of feature engineering turned out to be a bit overkill for this project, but it does provide a nice, easy to understand, demonstration of how to use the methods. Background In an effort to make sense of the torrent of data coming from the James Webb Telescope, we need fast and reliable ways to classifying and sifting through the data. At the Code for Good conference in 2017, I was involved with a project to help astrophysics categorize and curate these galaxy images.
